    • Method Detail

      • areValidNumbers

        public static boolean areValidNumbers(java.lang.Class c,
                      java.lang.String... numStrings)
        Convenience method. Calls isValidNumber on parameters with the given class.
        Parameters:
        c - the number type. Valid types are (wrappers included): double, int, float, long.
        numStrings - the string/strings/array of strings to check
        Returns:
        false if any return false on the isValidNumber call

      • isValidNumber

        public static boolean isValidNumber(java.lang.Class c,
                    java.lang.String numString)
        Does a try catch (Exception) on parsing the given string to the given type
        Parameters:
        c - the number type. Valid types are (wrappers included): double, int, float, long.
        numString - number to check
        Returns:
        false if there is an exception, true otherwise

      • round

        public static double round(double amount)
        Rounds the given amount half up by two digits (good for money)
        Parameters:
        amount - the double to round
        Returns:
        the rounded amount

      • round

        public static double round(double amount,
           int digits)
        Rounds the given amount half up to the given digits
        Parameters:
        amount - the double to round
        digits - the digits to round to
        Returns:
        the rounded amount

      • round

        public static double round(double amount,
           int digits,
           int round)
        Rounds the given amount by the given digits in the given direction
        Parameters:
        amount - the double to round
        digits - the digits to round to
        round - the type of round to perform
        Returns:
        the rounded amount for example BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP

      • cleanNumber

        public static java.lang.String cleanNumber(java.lang.String number)
        Removes all non number characters. Note: does not remove decimals (.) so a given number like this: 93)23.42-235.234 will come out looking like this 9323.42235.234
        Parameters:
        number -
        Returns:
